page.title: 07SETTLEMENT AROUND HEADCORN
page.content: {The main area of settlement}is centred around Headcorn's ancient Parish Church and the High Street. Here are the older houses such as Shakespeare House (1400),The Chantry (1466) and Rushford Manor (1740.{Terraced {Victorian dwellings}occur in Oak Lane and other detached houses of this period are found widely. The rate of growth in the village increased in the {'60's and '70's}with the building of large estates,both Council and private. A few smaller and private developments have occurred more {recently}and are considered to be "infilling". Beyond the confines of the village{scattered farm settlements and hamlets are common. Some of these are{"dens",such as Tilden,Moatenden or {Boarden}and are of Medieval origin. The conversion of redundant farm buildings appears to be growing.
